sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"尊重，钦佩"之意。
means: admire ：侧重指对某人或某物的仰慕、钦佩，并含欣赏爱慕之情。
honour ：侧重指对某人或某物表示极大的敬意。
respect ：指对人的行为、品德、才华或成就等的仰慕尊重。尤指对年长或地位高的人的尊敬。
regard ：最正式用词，中性，含义不很明确，一般需用修饰语加强或明确其意。
esteem ：除表示尊敬之外，还暗示由此而产生的称赞。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"尊敬，尊重，敬意"之意。
means: respect ： 指对年长、地位较高的人的尊敬，对他人成就、行为或见解等经过仔细评估后而表示尊重，暗示在上述人面前表现谦恭和有礼貌。
honour ： 指对长辈或有地位、有名望、有功劳的人公开表示极大敬意或软佩。
regard ： 最正式用词，中性，与respect和honour近义。
esteem ： 除表示尊敬之外，还暗示由此可而产生的称赞。
admiration ： 指除表示尊敬外，还常伴随有一种真挚的倾慕之情。

sentence.Network_en: The treaty binds them to respect their neighbour's independence.
sentence.Network_cn: 条约规定他们必须尊重其邻国的独立。

sentence.Network_en: We need to restore respect for the law-enforcement agencies.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们需要重塑执法机构的声望。

sentence.Network_en: I respect his judgement and I'll follow any advice he gives me.
sentence.Network_cn: 我尊重他的判断能力，会接受他提出的任何建议。

phrase.cizu_name: in respect of (或 with respect to)

lj.lj_ly: the two groups were similar with respect to age, sex, and diagnoses.
lj.lj_ls: 这两组人在年龄、性别和诊断结果方面都很相似。

jx.jx_en_mean: used as a polite formula preceding, and intended to mitigate the effect of, an expression of disagreement or criticism
jx.jx_cn_mean: 尽管（对您）尊敬之至 ［用于表示异议或批评的话之前］

lj.lj_ly: with all due respect, Father, I think you've got to be more broad-minded these days.
lj.lj_ls: 恕我直言，父亲，我认为这些日子您必须心胸更开阔些。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin respectus, from the verb respicere 'look back at, regard', from re- 'back' + specere 'look at'

entry.def: If you respect someone, you have a good opinion of their character or ideas.

example.ex: I want him to respect me as a career woman...
example.tran: 我希望他把我当作一个职业女性来尊重。

example.ex: He needs the advice of people he respects, and he respects you.
example.tran: 他需要从他敬重的人那里获得建议，而他一向都很敬重你。

entry.def: If you have respect for someone, you have a good opinion of them.

example.ex: I have tremendous respect for Dean...
His voice was warm with friendship and respect.
example.tran: 他的声音里充满了友善和敬意。

entry.def: If you respect someone's wishes, rights, or customs, you avoid doing things that they would dislike or regard as wrong.

example.ex: Finally, trying to respect her wishes, I said I'd leave.
example.tran: 最后，为了尊重她的意愿，我说我会离开。

entry.def: If you show respect for someone's wishes, rights, or customs, you avoid doing anything they would dislike or regard as wrong.

example.ex: They will campaign for the return of traditional lands and respect for aboriginal rights and customs.
example.tran: 他们会争取讨回世代相传的土地，并要求尊重土著居民的权利和风俗。

entry.tran: 遵守，遵从（法律或道德规范）
entry.def: If you respect a law or moral principle, you agree not to break it.

example.ex: It is about time tour operators respected the law and their own code of conduct.
example.tran: 旅行社是时候该遵守法律和行业规范了。

entry.tran: 恕我直言，恕我冒昧(用于礼貌地表示不同意见或批评)
entry.def: You can say with respect when you are politely disagreeing with someone or criticizing them.

example.ex: With respect, Minister, you still haven't answered my question...
example.tran: 部长，恕我冒昧，您还没有回答我的问题。

example.ex: With respect, I hardly think that's the point.
example.tran: 恕我直言，但我认为这不是重点。

entry.def: If you pay your respects to someone, you go to see them or speak to them. You usually do this to be polite, and not necessarily because you want to do it.

example.ex: Carl had asked him to visit the hospital and to pay his respects to Francis.
example.tran: 卡尔已经让他去医院看望弗朗西斯。

entry.tran: 和(死者)告别;参加…的葬礼
entry.def: If you pay your last respects to someone who has just died, you show your respect or affection for them by coming to see their body or their grave.

example.ex: The son had nothing to do with arranging the funeral, but came along to pay his last respects.
example.tran: 这个儿子没有参与葬礼的安排，但是来向遗体告别了。

entry.tran: 在这个方面/在许多方面
entry.def: You use expressions like in this respect and in many respects to indicate that what you are saying applies to the feature you have just mentioned or to many features of something.

example.ex: The children are not unintelligent—in fact, they seem quite normal in this respect...
example.tran: 这些孩子并非愚钝——事实上，在这个方面他们似乎很正常。

example.ex: In many respects Asian women see themselves as equal to their men.
example.tran: 在很多方面，亚洲女性都认为自己和丈夫是平等的。

entry.tran: 关于，至于（英国英语中也用in respect of）
entry.def: You use with respect to to say what something relates to. In British English, you can also say in respect of .

example.ex: Parents often have little choice with respect to the way their child is medically treated...
example.tran: 关于孩子的治疗方法，父母通常没有什么选择的余地。

example.ex: Where Dr Shapland feels the system is not working most effectively is in respect of professional training.
example.tran: 沙普兰博士认为系统在专业培训上的运作效率不是非常高。

means.word_mean: 1. (usually preceded by `in') a detail or point;
2. the condition of being honored (esteemed or respected or well regarded);

sentences.sentence: "a man who has earned high regard"

means.word_mean: 3. an attitude of admiration or esteem;
4. a courteous expression (by word or deed) of esteem or regard;

sentences.sentence: "his deference to her wishes was very flattering"
"be sure to give my respects to the dean"

means.word_mean: 5. behavior intended to please your parents;

sentences.sentence: "their children were never very strong on obedience"
"he went to law school out of respect for his father's wishes"

means.word_mean: 6. a feeling of friendship and esteem;

sentences.sentence: "she mistook his manly regard for love"

auth_sentence.content: It is just as important to respect their differences.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is just as important to respect their differences.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is just as important to respect their differences.

auth_sentence.content: Milan play for the right to respect all players.
auth_sentence.res_content: Milan play for the right to respect all players.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Milan play for the right to respect all players.

auth_sentence.content: That's a legacy that deserves the utmost respect.
auth_sentence.res_content: That's a legacy that deserves the utmost respect.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That's a legacy that deserves the utmost respect.

stems_affixes.word_buile: circum周围+spect看→看周围→小心
per全部+spect看+ive……的→看透了的→透视的
prospect前景+ive……的→adj.预期的
respect尊敬+able可以……的→adj.可敬的;人格高尚的
respect尊敬,尊重+ful有……的→adj.恭敬的,尊重的
re回+spect看+ive……的→回头看[自己]→各自的
retrospect[v.回顾,回想]+ive……的→adj.追想的,回顾的
spect看+acular……的→adj.壮观的,引人注目的 n.壮观的演出
respective[adj.各自的,各个的]+ly表副词→adv.分别地, 各个地
pro前面+spect看→向前看→前景

stems_affixes.value_cn: 样子, 外表, 面貌, [问题等的]方面
stems_affixes.word_buile: a加强意义+spect看→看的东西→外表,容貌
circumspect[adj.小心谨慎的]+ion表名词→n.细心,慎重
inspect[v.检查,调查,视察]+or人→n.检查员, 巡视员
inspect[v.检查,调查,视察]+ion表名词→n.检查,审查;检阅

stems_affixes.value_cn: 章程,内容简介;创办计划
stems_affixes.word_buile: pro前+spect看+us→向前看的东西
re再+spect看→再看[一眼]→尊敬
spect看+acle东西→看的东西→景象;眼镜
spect看+acular……的→adj.壮观的,引人注目的 n.壮观的演出
spect看+ator人→看的人
spect看+rum→可以看的范围
re再+spect看→再看[一眼]→尊敬
ex出+pect=spect看→看出去,看外面→期待
in内,里面+spect看→看里面→检查
retro向后+spect看→向后看
spec=spect看+ulate→看准了→思考,投机
sus下面+spect看→在下面看一看,斜眼看→怀疑

Sentence.sentence: One has to be respectful of other people in order to win respect.

The key to integrity is consistency- not only setting high personal standards for oneself (honesty, responsibility, respect for others, fairness) but also living up to those standards each and every day.
Harvard has a special opportunity to convey its respect for science not only through its research and teaching programs but also in its public affirmation of evidence-based inquiry.
They show inadequate respect for evidence-based inquiry
Her listeners were showing their respect for her by chewing on her words.

sentences.en: The terms of the agreement respect the boundary line between the two countries.
sentences.cn: 协议的条款涉及两国间的边界线。

sentences.en: The new teacher soon won the respect of his students.
sentences.cn: 这位新来的老师很快就赢得了学生们的尊重。

means.word_mean: 考虑, 关心, 顾虑

sentences.en: We must have respect to the needs of the general readers.
sentences.cn: 我们必须考虑一般读者的需要。

sentences.en: The plan is faulty in every respect.
sentences.cn: 无论从哪个方面来看这项计划都不完善。

sentences.en: Please send them my respects when you write.
sentences.cn: 你写信的时候请代我向他们致意。

jushi.english: He always respected opinions from the masses.
jushi.chinese: 他对群众的意见历来是十分尊重的。

jushi.english: We must respect each other's territorial integrity.
jushi.chinese: 我们应当尊重彼此的领土完整。

jushi.english: He was such a selfless man; everybody respected him.
jushi.chinese: 他是这样一个大公无私的人,人人都尊敬他。
